author: rkeithhill
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
cd <PowerShell or other large Git repo>
git ls-files --eol
# before the above command can finish press Ctrl+C
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```none
The command is aborted and I have my console back for use.
```

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
Output stops from git but the console appears to be hung.
```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-beta
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-beta.6
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.15063
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: This repros with cmd.exe not using PowerShell.  I suggest opening an issue in their [repo](https://github.com/git/git-scm.com/issues)

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body:
I tried it several times in cmd.exe before submitting this. It never hung in cmd.exe and always hung in powershell.exe.  

**Update**: doh!  Guess I didn't try it enough.  Yup, I did get it to hang just now.

title: Ctrl-C on git command hangs console - have to exit
